byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Investigation by Dept of Homeland Security inspector general John Roth finds that Deputy Sec Alejandro Mayorkas directly intervened to speed consideration of visas for foreign investors with ties to Democrats while he was head of visa agency; report suggests that Mayorkas' actions created resentment but stops short of calling them illegal; findings deal setback to Mayorkas, one of main architects of Pres Obama's executive actions on immigration.
lead_paragraph: The inspector general of the Department of Homeland Security has found that Alejandro Mayorkas, the deputy secretary, intervened directly to gain fast-track consideration of visas for well-connected foreign investors when he was the head of the visa agency.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds Homeland Security Official Intervened in Visa Cases
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds Homeland Security Official Intervened in Visa Cases
